input:
What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Actinic intraepidermal squamous cell carcinoma

ROLEPLAY SCRIPT:
YOU ARE A PATIENT: YOU ARE 65 AND YOUR BIOLOGICAL GENDER IS MALE.
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- A red, scaly patch on the side of your face that has been there for a few months
- A crusty, non-healing sore that doesn’t seem to go away despite over-the-counter treatments
- A raised growth with a central depression that recently appeared near your nose
- Any changes in existing moles or skin lesions that you’ve noticed over the past few weeks
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION:
They started gradually over the last three months, initially just a small, red patch that seemed to get slightly bigger and more scaly over time. The sore appeared about a month ago and hasn't healed, despite keeping it clean and applying ointments. The new growth developed within the last few weeks, and you've noticed it looks different from the other spots on your face. You’ve also observed some minor changes in a couple of moles on your arm, which now look darker and slightly raised. You’re increasingly concerned because these skin changes don’t seem to improve and worry they might be serious.
output:
THINKING: I should explain what’s been bothering me, but I’m a bit confused about when everything started and how it’s all coming together. I’ve had some skin patches and sores that haven’t healed, and now ther
ANSWER: Well, doctor, I’m 65 and I’m a guy. I’ve had this red, scaly patch on my face for a few months now, and it’s been slowly getting worse I think. Then about a month ago, I got this sore that doesn’t seem to go away no matter what I try. Just recently, I saw this raised bump with a little dip in the middle near my nose that wasn’t there before, and I also noticed some of my moles on my arm changing — they’re darker and a bit raised now. I guess I’m just worried because things don’t seem to be getting better, and I don’t know what’s going on.
thinking: I should explain what’s been bothering me, but I’m a bit confused about when everything started and how it’s all coming together. I’ve had some skin patches and sores that haven’t healed, and now ther
answer: Well, doctor, I’m 65 and I’m a guy. I’ve had this red, scaly patch on my face for a few months now, and it’s been slowly getting worse I think. Then about a month ago, I got this sore that doesn’t seem to go away no matter what I try. Just recently, I saw this raised bump with a little dip in the middle near my nose that wasn’t there before, and I also noticed some of my moles on my arm changing — they’re darker and a bit raised now. I guess I’m just worried because things don’t seem to be getting better, and I don’t know what’s going on.

I keep looking at it and thinking it looks different, but I don’t know for sure if it’s gotten worse or just the same.
